artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 280.9; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 88, p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; grimacing figure with red skin and beard, wearing green patterned kimono, partially reclining on floor on his stomach, with his chin behind held by a heavy-set bald man standing over him; heavy set man has pink and white skin with white circles and wears a crane patterned kimono with purple ground; brown demon with white hair and pink blouse at right; gesturing man in red kimono, URQ; pair of gruesome heads--red face frowning and white face smiling--in ULQ; books and scrolls with text, LRQ
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Essays by Yoshitoshi (Ikkai zuihitsu 一魁随筆)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Asahina Saburō Yoshihide
